name: Grosvenor House Dubai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had booked two premier rooms (we were 5 including two young children). On arrival, we had the choice to keep our two rooms or take an appartment with 2 bedrooms. After visiting both, we decided to have the apartment, although the premier rooms were lovely.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was perfect, we could go the tea and pre dinner drinks on the first floor with the kids or go to the 44th floor without the kids. Both experience were fabulous. We never waited more than 5 minutes for the shuttle to le royal meridien.
reviews.title: Grosvenor House is exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast on the 1st floor, lot's of choice and like every place in the hotel, perfect service.
reviews.title: The only place I will stay in Dubai - fantastic hotel in every way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: People making negative comments must have been to a different hotel !!
reviews.title: Pure unashamed luxury!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will be back for sure
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me tell you I am the the wort hotel guest my expectations are very high and when I pay high prices I feel that its right to want the best. This hotel does everything. The reason why is they have shipped in staff from Thailand and the Philippines where they know how to treat guests which is what you want. Friendly staff great service Bvlgari and Molton brown toiletries. Fantastic Indian restaurant in hotel plus Buddha bar.. They also give you cold towels by the pool and ice drinks which is great.. Highly recommend one of the best hotels i have ever visited and I have been to some of the best. By the way Its nicer than the Meridian as a business hotel so few children but you also have access to their pool.
reviews.title: Great standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I'm 30, male, and was alone before heading to Afghanistan. I wanted a hotel that was under 300$ (their site is cheaper than expedia, etc), clean, and a last piece of simple luxury before heading to the dry jungle. I needed a godo concierge, lots of internal space to get lost in, and staff who let me hang around, and help me get a visa, taxis, and faxes, etc. I also wanted great food. All of this was met with bang on furor!
reviews.title: Best ever breakfast and service for a construction site...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HOWEVER, the hotel is bang in the middle of a construction site. Not an issue really, but it is. The building's shadow BLOCKS THE SUN after about 1pm every day. This is mildly off set by the intuitive and epic pool-side staff and surprise amenities.
reviews.title: wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE BREAKFAST is LEGENDARY. Choose a country, choose a style of cheese, eggs, or any fruit found by Adam and Eve, sushi, nuts, even bacon, and you're on the right track.
reviews.title: FAB

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The access to the Meridien2 across the construction site is great as it's beachside and the shuttle avoids the construction.
reviews.title: Cosntruction Site!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we were met at the Airport by a butler who escorted us and our luggage to our awaiting BMW limo ,we knew that this break would be something special.
reviews.title: Blown away by the service , shame about the construction work
top notch again...........
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel and must have been helped or welcomed by 10 people by the time we had made it to our room . Or room was a club floor room on 39th floor .It was very nicely decoarted in a contemporary style ,if a little on the small side and didn't have a balcony . That said it was very nice and there were nice welcoming touches like wine and chocolates and each day we were given treats and fruit . There was also a nightly turndown service with chocolates and a rose on the pillow .

reviews.title: Fab hotel BUT.......
reviews.text: As we had paid for club floor ,we had access to the lounge on the 44th floor . We found this excellent value for money ,with daily afternoon tea and 2 hours of cocktails and canapes . The staff in the lounge were excellent and the drinks flowed freely .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As previously mentioned the construction in the area was immense and constant but I cannot mark the hotel down because of this as it was hardly apparent once inside and the hotel was exceptional in every other sense.
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2nd visit to GHH and once again it delivers some of the most stunning interior design and fantastic service I have ever had the privilige to experience.
reviews.title: Perfect save for location and the construction work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It’s still a hotel I always chose to go back to again and again, we visited 4 times last year.
reviews.title: Still Great..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: Let me start by saying I am one of the fussiest people with everything especially when it comes to cleanliness and service. This hotel is near to perfect for me. Its’ a hotel where anything is possible and nothing is too much trouble. The service is generally impeccable.
reviews.title: Very clean and excellent service!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We got engaged on a yacht out there and the hotel sorted this all with my husband down to every small detail. There were no screw ups as there would have been in the UK or Europe it was perfect. We have had many celebrations out there and they make a big effort and make you feel special..
reviews.title: Grosvenor House - Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used to always stay in a one bed suite GH1 with club lounge they closed it in August and moved it to GH2 as well as increasing the price of the room with the lounge. You are also not able to use the Club Lounge in GH2 if you are in GH1. I think there could be more flexibility here and maybe there will be eventually but not at the moment..
reviews.title: This hotel has everything you may want

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Is it worth paying nearly double the price for the new hotel. My answer is not necessarily.. the new club lounge is good but the views in tower one were fantastic the palm etc and in Tower 2 there are no real views.
reviews.title: Just keeps getting better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had high hopes for Grosvenor House following fab reviews on Tripadvisor, but it was not a good start when we arrived at the hotel and the moody door man couldn’t find our name on his list which we had to point out to him. We were then sat down in a rather impressive reception area and told that someone who be over to check us in. Check-in was slow and handle by three people rather than one person in a swift manner. Unfortunately a room wasn’t ready for us and we were shown to Leaves lounge where we could have breakfast and wait for our room. We understand that we were checking in early and that a room might not be ready but the most frustrating thing about the wait was not having any information on when our room would be ready, so we ended up wasting a day waiting for the room in the hope that it would be available quickly. But access to Leaves was welcome, staff were courteous and the food, though limited, was fresh.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had room 1417 which was an apartment in tower one. It was a large one bed room apartment with kitchen, lounge/diner, bedroom and bathroom (with rain shower and bath). The room was in good condition and nice and light, though the lights worked in a bit of an odd way, but more lights than some of the newer hotels. Unfortunately the room wasn’t sound proof and we were disturbed by traffic and beeping car horns throughout the night and noisy neighbours in the room above so lacked a decent night’s sleep. I thought the bed was ok, but it gave my husband back ache.
reviews.title: Beautiful and great food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room servicing was haphazard and slow; on some days the room wasn't serviced until 4pm. Some days rubbish would be removed, sometimes not, or cups just get put in the dishwasher but left dirty. Maybe it was my job to turn on the dishwasher? Either way, the room was not “reset” on a daily basis, we would really just get clean towels, floors mats weren’t even changed just hovered. Turn down services started early at about 5pm, which was really annoyingly when the room had only been cleaned at 4pm and when we asked the staff to return later to provide fresh towels they never did.
reviews.title: Unprecedented luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: Service in the hotel as a whole was generally unfriendly, arrogant and uncaring. There were a few friendly people in Leaves, Sloanes and at the front desk, but no happy greetings or warmth from staff standing around hotel, or staff in general during any interactions. Door men were particularly rude and grumpy and one even let a door to slam in my face as he watch me followed behind him – maybe they expected a tip every time I requested an already waiting taxi? Whatever it was they were unfriendly and unwilling.
reviews.title: Amazing stay at an awesome hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only had food in Sloanes and in the Retreat spa. Sloanes for breakfast is poorly organised. Staff don’t know when people have left so leave tables dirty unsure if they are still occupied while a queue is backing waiting to be seated. They need to get on top of this, other hotels don’t have these problems. The food was ok, a little stale in places as it’s left out for a long time. One morning we went down at 6am expecting everything to be fresh but were faced with stale bread / pastries, dried up fruit. Even the watermelon juice was suspect making us both ill on separate occasions.
reviews.title: Incredible Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I recently stayed at Grovesnor House for four nights. I am not one who has enjoyed travelling in the past but this hotel was truly amazing. The staff were so very attentive and genuinely friendly and the hotel was beautiful in every way. The attention to detail in the decor and the standard of service was impeccable. I was delighted with the numerous treats provided by the hotel daily ; inspirational quotes, roses, chocolates and food what more could a lady want! it really made you feel special. The room service was also fabulous, on two occasions we ordered a snack and it came like a three course meal. It was as if they had thought of everything in this hotel. They even had english plugs in the rooms!
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot wait to vist this hotel again! It was a very relaxing place, the spar was so plush, candles and petals galore, I did not want to come home.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel... with not so consistent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009
reviews.text: Thankyou to all the staff!
reviews.title: Par excellance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grosvenor House is an excellent property, unfortunately our stay was not flawless like other travelers have stated in there reviews. We checked in for four nights on a Tuesday at around 4:30 in the afternoon, we had booked a deluxe room with breakfast. On arrival we were greeted with a friendly smile, however were not offered a welcome drink and a towel unlike other guests checking in next to us. We were assigned a beautifully appointed room on the 18th flour, unfortunate for us the view was of the construction of the Grosvenor house tower 2, my wife and I decided not to complain and head to the mall. When we arrived back to the hotel at around midnight looking forward to a clean turned down bed, we walked in to the room finding it in the same way we had left it, however the worst had to come, I woke up at 7 am by the construction noise. That is when we decided to complain. I spoke to the assistant front house manager about the problems and with no arguments we were offered to move to a new room with the marina view, surprisingly they had upgraded us to a 1bedroom apartment. The apartment was on the 39th flour so the noise problems were solved. The only problem with our apartment 3912 was that the bathroom was not as good as the one in the deluxe room, there was no separate shower, the shower was hand healed and was in the tub, for some one who is use to taking a shower with jets at home this is a big disappointment, I didn't want to complain again as I felt they had done to much by giving us the apartment. In conclusion the hotel was excellent and beautifully appointed, however the service was not consistent, sometimes it felt exceptional and sometimes very average.
reviews.title: Had to tell the world how amazing this hotel is !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from a short leisurely break with my daughter, from what i can only describe as the best hotel i've ever stayed in. The service is second to none and the room upgrade was even better. Nothing was too much trouble for the hotel staff, in fact some British hotels could take a few lessons from them!! Joy, the waiter in Sloanes was an absolute credit to the restaurant. Not that the others weren't, but he just went the extra mile. It would be nice if he could be recognised for this and my comments passed on to him. The food was also out of this world, and you could even have a roast dinner if wanted...........the beef melted in the mouth, our compliments to all the chefs. Bar 44 was brilliant, and i even managed to stay up to enjoy the entertainment. We had a day around the pool which was superb. Fresh fruit and water with plenty of well needed ice, was on hand constantly. What a great service! My daughter also had a fantastic time, Dubai is a shopaholics paradise, which is exactly what she is!
reviews.title: Sheer Luxury!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: "Everything was just perfect.. The food, the service, location.. Everything.. I'll be back !
reviews.title: Absolutely Superb !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Have stayed here on several occasions. Have always had a beautiful suite. The service is 7 star all the restaurnts are too. Service is paramount in this hotel. Will not bother to go anywhere else unless we stay at their other hotel The Royal Meridien. Equally as good.
reviews.title: Perfection!!

likes.disliked: — have to get a free shuttle bus across the road to beach.

reviews.title: Great Expectations Lead To Disappointment
reviews.text: I've stayed at a number of high end hotels in Dubai; Crown Plaza, Hyatt Regency, Hilton, Sheraton Creek, Radison, Habtoor Grand, Fairmont, etc...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On my next trip to Dubai I would prefer any of the above to Grosvenor house. It wasn't particularly terrible, just that things weren't quite up to par. The hotel staff seemed very kind and well meaning, but lacking in capability.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel but marred by construction

likes.disliked: — The Construction Work and Pool Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These may seem like small nitpicks but they really are inconveniences that just wouldn't happen at other hotels. One or two is understandable but once a pattern developes it's clear that Grosvenor has some service shortcomings.
reviews.title: Greatest Modern Hotel in Dubai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: The service is just amazing! Most probably you wouldn't hear sorry for any request.l would highly recommend premier room which will truly spoil you and is absolutely value for money.Their shuttel service to mall of emirates and next hotel is also good.Hotel highly recommended!
reviews.title: Hospitality as it should be!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Another great stay at Grosvenor House Dubai.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay at the Grosvenor House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed in Tower two in Premier room and had the benifit of the lovely club lounge with complimentary drinks and light bites etc.
reviews.title: Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The lounge is divided into sections with bar and buffet areas which have some hot food salad sandwiches etc and at lunch time the selection is more than adequate to fill up on, no complimentary alcholic drinks at lunch but they are available to buy.
reviews.title: Good but too formal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Evening is all complimentary inc Alcohol, and a good place to start your evening off and well worth the extra cost of a Premier room.
reviews.title: Average Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a dinner reservation for the Mezzanine last July, we were staying elsewhere at the time but would have swapped hotels had we known how beautiful and serene the GHH was. Our dinner was divine and service impeccable. Definitely warrants a visit/reservation.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, excellent hospitality, service second to none

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we were there last, I had popped into the ladies cloakroom on the ground floor and had left my ring by the basin after washing my hands. When I sat down in the Mezzanine's pre dinner drinks lounge, my husband noticed my missing ring. I when down the elevator, where the girl on the ground floor asked me what was wrong, I mentioned my missing ring (my fault entirely) and she helped me search the ladies cloakroom to no avail. However, she said she would check with the housekeeper and see if it had been handed in. I went back to the Mezzanine and whilst still drinking my cocktail, the Manager plus entourage, came up to me and showed me a ring that had been handed in. This was indeed my ring. I was amazed. So thank you GHH and your wonderful staff. I shall be booking my Mezzanine reservation for Oct this year and this stime I shall have my two adult sons with us. So, cannot wait to impress them!
reviews.title: Still the best hotel in Dubai !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We returned to this hotel after our best holiday we ever had last year and the standards have not dropped they have got better. There is a lot of construction outside due to the sister hotel which is being build. This did not make any difference to us because we did not hear hardly any noise also the hotel put a gift in the room to say sorry for and inconvenience caused by the construction which was a nice touch. I would recommend you book a club room which is really good value. This is the best hotel in dubai by far i have stayed in lots of hotels in dubai and the personal service you get her is unbelievable. Special praise to Zia from the club room lounge if u go please say hello to him from Mr Mark and also Farhan who delivered fruit to our room they made our holiday. We will be back for sure next year thank you.
reviews.title: A great hotel!
Nowhere or nothing else compares!
reviews.text: Grosvenor House is a charming hotel in all aspects.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009
reviews.text: Great staff, perfect accomodation, good food....
reviews.title: Absolutely terrific!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned after spending 2 nights at this Hotel as a stop overon our way home from London. Firstly can I say that the staff and their service were impeccable. The hotel was extremely clean and the flower arrangements were just beautiful.
reviews.title: Wow Wow Wow
Outstanding Experience
reviews.text: The hotel is well situated with a short walk to both the beach and the metro and with ample number of taxis it is very easy to get anywhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: We were celebrating our 30th Wedding Anniversary and we were very surprised and very much delighted to find a beautiful bouquet of flowers, a plate of fruit and a bottle of Champagne upon our return to our room the first night. We were also surprised with a cake in the Turkish restaurant downstairs after we finished dinner.
reviews.title: One word is enough - FABULOUS!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: I had a very relaxing and soothing massage in the day spa whilst my husband was relaxing in the pool.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: What can I say , we felt like we were treated like a King and a Queen.
reviews.title: Grovesnor House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grosvenor House Hotel for 5 nights from 2nd March this year. I cannot recommend it highly enough. Rooms weren't ready when we arrived at 10am but we were offered coffee and pastries... Our room overlooked tower 2 on the 10th floor and was excellent. We also had a view of the palm and marina... We has a lovely large bed with excellent pillows... All the staff in the hotel couldn't do enough for you. Buffet breakfast was fantastic. What a choice...
reviews.title: Best hotel we've stayed in...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I would say this is more a business hotel than their sister hotel Le Royal Meridian. Le Meridian is just a short shuttle bus away and had lovely pools and right on the beach... The rooftop pool at the Grosvenor is great but does loose the sun by 1pm... Would defineley return to this Excellent hotel...
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Standard rooms are excellent, plenty of space with a balcony. Beds are comfortable and the hotel offers a superb choice of restaurants either in-house or at their sister hotel nearby. I did check-in somewhat late (3am) and the process was perhaps not as efficient as I might have expected, but overall the service attitude throughout the hotel was exemplary in my experience. Recommend the Gary Rhodes Mezzanine restaurant - wonderful food.
reviews.title: Clean Suits

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is located on Marina Walk. This is one of the best places in Dubai, because there are many restaurants around. I am staying in a suit where is good for families.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Simply great stay. Good value for the money.
reviews.title: No surprises - 5 star appartment option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Grosvenor House on several occasions. It is the best hotel we have stayed in... service, food, rooms and facilities are all beyond expectations. Breakfast is outstanding. the rooms are lovely and we have appreciated the upgrades we have been given.The free shuttle service to Le Royal Meridien Beach Resort and Spa is excellent.
reviews.title: Great hotel in every respect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel, together with Le Royal Meridien will always be our first choice for a stay in Dubai.
reviews.title: Believe what you read...the reviews are all true!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: We're just back from a week at the GH and absolutely loved it! We've been lucky enough to stay at some lovely hotels and have a preference for boutique hotels due to the personalised feel to the service. So, it was with great delight and surprise that the GH staff manage to make you feel special even although they have many guests to look after. Nothing was too much trouble, you were always met with a wonderful smile and your name was remembered.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel, food fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants, bars and lounges in Tower 1 and Tower 2 were all amazing- although they can be a tad pricey compared to the UK - but worth it!
reviews.title: Always consistent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We particularly enjoyed the Indian - Indigo, Bar 44 and the Embassy Club (Tower 2)...Bar Buddha was ok, but full of people who 'wanted to be seen' - so slightly pretentious.
reviews.title: Location Location!
Not Recommended
reviews.text: The Grosvenor is much more suited to the business traveller so someone looking for a relaxing and peaceful holiday should choose elsewhere. The staff were generally good and food was excellent but having stayed at 6 other hotels in Dubai this is to be expected. There's many problems in our opinion though with this hotel. Our first problem encountered was trying to get ice delivered to your room, on one occasion we waited for 20 mins whereas many hotels we've stayed at in Dubai the staff seem to know your habits and have ice ready upon your return to the room. Another surprise was none of the hotel bars served draught beer which is unheard of at 5 star hotels in Dubai. A nice cold beer at the pool?? Forget it at the Grosvenor, you'll be lucky to get much better than a slightly cold bottle. Make sure you get down to breakfast early as you may face a long delay, as previously stated, the hotel caters for many business conferences etc so much of the dining space is often taken by business types rather than hotel guests. The hotel has internet access in the business centre which is free to use but don't get excited as it was virtually useless with speeds worse than dial up. Perhaps the worst thing about this hotel was the pool. Some bright architect decided to place the pool on the 4th of a 44 floor hotel which meant sunbathing was finished at around 1pm and than it was a battle for a beds on just one side as the sun passed over the hotel. Considering this hotel is not near the beach then i find this incredible. The other option is to climb into the free shuttle bus to the sister hotel le royal meridien about 5 mins away. Perhaps the worst feature of this hotel is the surrounding building work and noise which, expected anywhere in Dubai is by far and away worse than ever at this hotel. Day and night the noise was unrelenting with cranes literally swinging over you at the pool! I'm surprised this hotel and the Meridien are so high up on tripadvisor and i suspect alot of the reviews are by first time visitors to Dubai rather than seasoned visitors.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: This place is great. After traveling for 20 hours, it was a great place to rest. Buddha Bar is one of the best places to go out and located in the hotel. The rooms are comfortable, the location is great... next to the beach. I highly recommend it, the best nicest hotel I've stayed in for that price. Their was some mix up in our transportation to the airport and the door man decided to pay for our cab.
reviews.title: Great Service: Would have picked my nose if I asked!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just spent 4 nights at GHH,celebrating my husbands 40th birthday.. and It was wonderful,words cannot discribe this fantastic hotel,the service is wonderful and you really do feel like royality,I didn't want to come home....from the moment we arrived nothing was to much trouble,the wonderful staff pampered us beyond belief,the butler even decorated our room with balloons and banners for my husbands birthday... please don't hesitate to book this hotel..I can't understand why it's not rated no 1 on tripadvisor???? it is at least 7 stars all the way....We can't thank you enough GHH.
reviews.title: It's all true, this place is fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't stress enough what a truly amazing hotel the Grosvenor House really is. We read most of the reviews on this website before we went and yes, they are all very true!
reviews.title: Wow, what an amazing hotel. Why can't all 5 star hotels be like this?

likes.disliked: — The GHH don't give you anything to dislike about their hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to many 5 star hotels all over the world but I can honestly say that none of them even get close to the very high standards of the GHH.
reviews.title: Best holiday ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel based on the TA reviews and were not disappointed. Staff greeted us warmly and were amazingly helpful throughout our stay. Our deluxe room was spacious and probably the quietest of any hotel room we have stayed in.
reviews.title: Fantastic!
Luxury Hotel at its best!!
reviews.text: What makes this hotel fantastic is that they consider all the details. There was a great hair dryer, an iron and board, comfy bed, good water pressure, Bulgari toiletries, the list goes on. Our only petty complaint was that our remote needed batteries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were sad to leave and would definitely like to stay here again.
reviews.title: Thanks Grosvenor House and tripadvisor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Recently stayed for 5 night break. Absolutely excellent hotel, nice rooms, very attentive service. Room was spacious, with plenty of tea/coffee. Beds were the most comfortable I have experienced!. Buffet breakfast in Sloane's was extensive - no need for lunch!. Also had buffet dinner in this restaurant, quite pricy but actually good value with the extent of options offered. Location was great for marina/beach with good shuttle service to sister hotel. Metro station a 10 minute walk away. One of the top hotels I have stayed in!
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected Grosvenor House for our recent stopover in Dubai because of the recommendations and ranking on tripadvisor and we couldn't have been happier. It deserves its 5 star rating as everything about it is first-class. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment which was very spacious and lovely. The staff deserve a special mention - such warm hospitality and excellent service from everyone but a special mention for Mohammed, who organised a beautiful chocolate mousse cake to celebrate the birthday of one of our party. Another special thanks to Nuvine who rang to check availability at two of the restaurants and then escorted us to each so that we could have a look and select one that appealed. Thank you very much and one of our party is already planning a return visit.
reviews.title: Best Hotel and service ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: This has to be the best hotel I've ever stayed at. The service is impeccable! Thank you to Mohammed in guest services for all the help and accommodations and Tracy at Toro Toro for the amazing drinks! Must stay in Dubai.
reviews.title: Best hotel I ever stayed at!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: What can I say - second time back and still as amazing as ever! We were upgraded to a suite as it was our wedding anniversary and return guests. All the staff are just so helpful - everyone smiles and says hello and are always willing to help. This time we had dinner at Indigo by Vineet - this is possibly the best Indian food we have ever eaten and would thoroughly recommend it. We love this hotel so much that we are already planning to come back in March with the family. Thanks again for an amazing stay!!
reviews.title: Another amazing stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is well known as one of Dubai's best and it continues to perform very well. The location is not great, in the middle of the concrete jungle that is Dubai Marina, but a 5 minute free shuttle takes you to the sister hotel on the beach.
reviews.title: Top place; Top staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rooms are excellent; restaurants top class; staff absolutely brilliant and without exception were ready and prepared to go the extra mile.
reviews.title: Warm, Luxurious, Confortable, and everybody is friendly and nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The deal we had represented wonderful value for money and whilst I am sure that this proce would not always be available, I would be prepared to pay more for the quality received.
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel, the staff were brilliant, the food is excellent, there are a lot of restaurants within the hotel so the choice is vast, and all very good quality.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms were amazing, ours had 2 bathrooms!! with a seperate lounge and a kitchen area. The beds were very comfortable the whole stay was absolutely brilliant and we'd definitely go back.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Fantastic ! From check-in till check-out.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was great (view on the Palm), the food was excellent and the hotel services more than perfect.
reviews.title: Nice but flawed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will come back for sure !
reviews.title: top class hotel

description: A flawless Arabian jewel in the heart of new Dubai and with the clear blue waters of the Arabian Gulf at its doorstep, stands Grosvenor House. 422 stunning rooms, suites or apartment suites to choose from and you will get a spectacular view of the Dubai Marina or the Arabian Gulf. With 12 exotic restaurants and bars, there will never be a dull moment. Retreat Health & Spa invigorates the senses and rejuvenates the body.
